intro: Viola dehnhardtii var. burgalensis, commonly known as the Burgalense Violet, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodland habitats, preferring well-drained, loamy soils. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to its natural environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
